~+This page explains the English text used on the Translate English to Linux page.+~<<BR>>

<<BR>>A computer has disks.
A disk has partitions. A partition has a file system.

<<BR>>A computer has operating systems.
<<BR>>An operating system has a name space.
<<BR>>A name space is the collection of all the names used by the operating system.
<<BR>>The names in a name space name different kinds of objects.
<<BR>>
<<BR>>An operating system has folders.
A folder has a name. 
A folder is a container of names. 
It can contain zero or more names. 
The names can be names of any kind of object. 
A folder has a size. 
The size of a folder is the sum of size of an empty folder plus the size of all the objects named in the folder.
A directory is a another name for a folder.
